title: P. J. Olsson
text:
Paul Josef Olsson is an American singer, most notable as being the lead singer for the <a href="Alan%20Parsons">Alan Parsons Live Project</a>. He has toured with various artists over his lifetime, including Rufus Wainright, Beth Orton, and Placebo.
Biography.
He was born in <a href="Houghton%2C%20Michigan">Houghton, Michigan</a> to a musical family. His father had a <a href="Doctor%20of%20Musical%20Arts">DMA</a> in choral music and was an <a href="avant-garde">avant-garde</a> <a href="12-tone%20composer">12-tone composer</a>, <a href="A%26amp%3BR">A&R</a> executive for <a href="Motown%20Records">Motown Records</a> and later a professor at <a href="Michigan%20Tech">Michigan Tech</a>; his mother was a music/voice major and schoolteacher. He started playing violin at age 6. PJ caught the attention of <a href="Columbia%20records">Columbia records</a>, who in mid-2000 released the album "Words For Living" which received positive reviews in the United States. Olsson also made an appearance on the "<a href="Late%20Show%20with%20David%20Letterman">Late Show with David Letterman</a>", and his song "Ready for a Fall" was included on the soundtrack album for the television show "<a href="Dawson%27s%20Creek">Dawson's Creek</a>". In 2002, Olsson joined the <a href="Alan%20Parsons">Alan Parsons</a> Live Project, becoming their lead singer. He has performed with many other notable acts, including <a href="Kid%20Rock">Kid Rock</a>, <a href="Muse%20%28band%29">Muse</a>, <a href="Train%20%28band%29">Train</a>, <a href="Rufus%20Wainright">Rufus Wainright</a>, <a href="Iggy%20Pop">Iggy Pop</a>, <a href="Beth%20Orton">Beth Orton</a>, <a href="Bob%20Geldof">Bob Geldof</a>, <a href="Something%20Corporate">Something Corporate</a>, <a href="Ben%20Harper">Ben Harper</a>, <a href="Nelly%20Furtado">Nelly Furtado</a>, <a href="Placebo%20%28band%29">Placebo</a>, and <a href="Michelle%20Branch">Michelle Branch</a>. In 2007 Olsson teamed up with <a href="Salman%20Ahmad">Salman Ahmad</a> to record a remake of the <a href="Nick%20Lowe">Nick Lowe</a> song, "<a href="%28What%27s%20So%20Funny%20%27Bout%29%20Peace%2C%20Love%2C%20and%20Understanding">(What's So Funny 'Bout) Peace, Love, and Understanding</a>", as the theme to <a href="The%20CW">The CW</a> television show "<a href="Aliens%20in%20America">Aliens in America</a>".
